name: Advanced Bioarchaeology
description: This course will combine theory learned in ANT340H5, Osteological Theory, with bioarchaeological methods to teach students how to conduct and interpret an osteobiography of human skeletal remains. Lectures and labs will cover techniques of sex determination, age estimation, stature calculation, evaluating health and nutrition, assessing markers of occupational stress, osteometrics, biological distance studies, and paleodemography. [24L, 24P]ANT441H5 is offered in alternate years, alternating with ANT439H5.
